intro: Crotalaria occidentalis, commonly known as the western crown flower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the southern United States. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers with a crown-like structure. The plant has compound leaves with small, oval-shaped leaflets and produces pods that contain several seeds. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in dry, arid conditions. Due to its ornamental value and ability to fix nitrogen, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and agricultural settings.
